The move came after the [ ]

articles.title: TP Solar produces 940 MW cell, 990 MW module in Q3
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 7 (PTI) TP Solar, an arm of Tata Power, has reported a manifold growth in its cell production to 940 megawatt (MW) during the December quarter of FY26, from 196 MW in the same quarter of the preceding financial year. The company produced 990 MW modules in Q3FY26, around 7 per cent [ ]

articles.title: India’s GDP seen growing 7.4 pc in FY26, fastest in the world
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 7 (PTI) The Indian economy is expected to grow by 7.4 per cent in the current fiscal, maintaining its status as the world s fastest-growing major economy despite punitive US tariffs and geopolitical tensions. The First Advance Estimates released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) on Wednesday put GDP growth [ ]

articles.title: NDMC presents surplus budget for 2026-27; rules out property tax hike
articles.summary: New Delhi, January 7 (PTI) The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) presented a surplus budget for the 2026-27 fiscal year on Wednesday, forecasting a net surplus of Rs 143.05 crore. During the announcement, the council also revealed plans to install 2,000 CCTVs throughout Lutyens Delhi, while confirming that property tax rates will remain unchanged. Presenting [ ]

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty extend losses into 3rd session on geopolitical concerns, trade uncertainties
articles.summary: Mumbai, Jan 7 (PTI) Stock market benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty drifted lower for the third day in a row on Wednesday as geopolitical tensions and renewed concerns about potential US tariff hikes weighed on investor sentiment. Sustained foreign fund outflows also dragged the markets lower, traders said. However, buying on select blue-chip counters and [ ]

articles.title: Shyam Steel ropes in India cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur as brand ambassador
articles.summary: Kolkata, Jan 7 (PTI) TMT bars producer Shyam Steel on Wednesday announced the appointment of Indian women s cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur as its brand ambassador. As part of the partnership, Kaur will also be associated with the company s digital home-building platform, which offers support for homeowners from planning and material selection to execution and [ ]

articles.title: India’s GDP estimated to grow at 7.4 pc in FY26
articles.summary: New Delhi, Jan 7 (PTI) The Indian economy is likely to grow at 7.4 per cent in 2025-26, up from 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal, mainly on account of better performance of manufacturing and services sectors, as per the government data released on Wednesday. According to the first advance estimates of national income [ ]

articles.title: Tata Power to set up Rs 6,675 cr 10 GW ingot & wafer manufacturing facility in AP
articles.summary: Amaravati, Jan 7 (PTI) Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd (TPREL) will set up a greenfield 10 GW ingot and wafer manufacturing facility at Nellore, Andhra Pradesh, with an investment of Rs 6,675 crore. The project will be the largest ingot and wafer manufacturing facility in the country, reinforcing Andhra Pradesh s position as a leading hub for [ ]

articles.title: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw discusses manufacturing of sovereign, high-end GPUs in India with Nvidia officials
articles.summary: India is stepping up plans to build its own graphics processors after talks between minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Nvidia executives. The discussions covered sovereign GPUs and local manufacturing of advanced AI devices. The government is also expanding subsidised access to GPUs to boost domestic AI development.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI quarterly net loss widens to $1.46 billion: Bloomberg
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s AI firm xAI posted a net loss of $1.46 billion for the September quarter, despite revenue almost doubling to $107 million, according to a report by Bloomberg. However, when contacted ‌by ‍Reuters for comment, xAI ‍replied with the message, "Legacy Media Lies." This comes as xAI announced a $20 billion funding round to expand its AI capabilities.

articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI to build $20 billion data centre in Mississippi
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s xAI plans to invest $20 billion in a vast data centre in Southaven, Mississippi, the state’s biggest-ever private project. The site will host "the world's largest supercomputer" with 2 gigawatts of computing power. The announcement comes as xAI faces scrutiny over its data centre projects in the Memphis area.

articles.title: TikTok picked by FIFA as video content partner at 2026 World Cup
articles.summary: FIFA has named TikTok its first preferred social media video platform at the men’s World Cup. Creators will gain special access and limited match content at the 2026 tournament across North America. FIFA did not state the value of the deal, or details of any tender process or rival bidders.

articles.title: Apple Card switches hands but no immediate changes for users
articles.summary: Apple has confirmed JPMorgan will become the new issuer of the Apple Card, replacing Goldman Sachs, with no changes for customers. Rewards, savings features and Mastercard access will stay the same during the transition. The deal, closing in about two years, solidifies JPMorgan’s leading position in the US credit card market.

articles.title: EU antitrust regulators to decide on Google's Wiz deal by February 10
articles.summary: EU antitrust officials will decide by February 10 on Google owner Alphabet’s planned $32 billion purchase of cybersecurity firm Wiz. Announced last March, the acquisition secured the US green light in November last year. Tech ‍deals have in recent years faced ‌intense regulatory scrutiny on concerns that dominant companies may further boost their market power.

articles.title: Exclusive: Razorpay invites banker pitches for IPO; targets Rs 4,500 crore fundraise
articles.summary: Razorpay has begun formal preparations for a stock market debut, inviting merchant bankers to pitch for its IPO mandate, people familiar with the matter told ET. The digital payments firm is looking to raise up to Rs 4,500 in fresh capital.

articles.title: China is investigating Meta's latest AI acquisition
articles.summary: China is investigating whether Meta's acquisition of the artificial intelligence startup Manus violated its laws on technology exports and outbound investment. Those rules say that the Chinese government must approve the export of certain technologies, including interactive AI systems.

articles.title: Humanoid robots go for knockout in high-tech Vegas fight night
articles.summary: At a CES-adjacent event in Las Vegas, humanoid robots battled in an Ultimate Fighting Robot match at BattleBots Arena. Controlled by human pilots, the MMA-style fights aim to boost entertainment, attract fans to humanoid robotics, and collect movement data for research and development.

articles.title: Dose of uncertainty: Experts wary of AI health gadgets at CES
articles.summary: At CES, health gadgets promise better heart, fertility and menopause care, but experts warn of shaky accuracy and privacy. As the FDA relaxes oversight under AI-friendly policies, innovators tout access and efficiency, while critics stress bias, data misuse and that consumer tech can’t replace doctors.

articles.title: Gmail's new AI features, turning it into personal assistant
articles.summary: The new AI features announced Thursday could herald a pivotal moment for Gmail, a service that transformed email when it was introduced nearly 22 years ago. Since then, Gmail has amassed more than 3 billion users to become nearly as ubiquitous as Google's search engine.

articles.title: IIIT Dharwad to deploy India's first commercial quantum computer, says Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Information Technology, Dharwad (IIIT-D), will deploy India's first commercial quantum computer at its newly announced Centre for Excellence in Quantum AI and Computing, said Karnataka IT/BT Minister Priyank Kharge.

articles.title: Flipkart appoints Gunjan Bhartia as SVP business finance
articles.summary: The company said that Bhartia will lead business finance for Flipkart's in-house logistics unit eKart across all verticals. He has previously held senior positions at companies such as GE and Coupang.

articles.title: Apple loses Safari lead designer to Browser Company, the firm behind AI browsers Arc & Dia
articles.summary: Apple's senior leadership continues to see significant departures, with its lead Safari designer, Marco Triverio, joining The Browser Company. This move means The Browser Company now employs lead designers from every Safari era overlapping with their Arc and Dia browsers (2020-2025). The company aims to build the industry's most exceptional AI interface and product talent team.

articles.title: Microsoft layoffs: Company denies reports of 22,000 job cuts
articles.summary: Microsoft has denied reports it plans to cut up to 22,000 jobs, calling the claims unfounded. The rumours, which spread online, suggested wide-ranging layoffs across key divisions - gaming, Azure, and sales. While recent job cuts have fuelled scepticism, the company says no such move is planned.

articles.title: Dancing isn't enough: Industry pushes for practical robots
articles.summary: Humanoid robots danced, somersaulted, dealt blackjack and played ping-pong at the Consumer Electronics Show this week, but some in the industry are impatient for them to become more useful, not just a promise of things to come. - According to the Consumer Technology Association that runs CES, the robotics industry is showing dynamism and potential.

articles.title: Discord, Snap investor Niko Bonatsos departs General Catalyst, plans new VC firm
articles.summary: Niko Bonatsos has quit General Catalyst after a 15-year tenure, a mutual decision that sees him exploring new ventures. He plans to launch his own firm, focusing on backing young founders, particularly within the burgeoning AI startup scene. This exit follows other senior departures from the venture capital firm.

articles.title: JPMorgan to replace Goldman as Apple Card issuer
articles.summary: JPMorgan Chase will replace Goldman Sachs as the issuer of the Apple Card, bringing over $20 billion in balances to its platform. The deal strengthens JPMorgan’s credit card business, while Goldman continues to scale back consumer operations. Completion depends on regulatory approval and is expected in about two years.

articles.title: Amagi Media trims IPO size, targets $869 million post-money valuation to woo investors
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs has cut the size and pricing of its IPO, valuing the company below its previous $1.4 billion valuation. The move reflects strong cash flows, reduced need for dilution and investor feedback. The listing highlights a wider reset in valuations across enterprise software firms.

articles.title: Arali Ventures nets 23x return on full exit from HBOX
articles.summary: This follows remote health technology startup HBOX securing strategic growth investment from the Charlesbank Technology Opportunities Fund. Arali Ventures had invested in HBOX at the time of its inception. HBOX is a US-headquartered remote health technology startup, with its core engineering and delivery teams based in India.

articles.title: Trump shifts FTC pick to White House role advising on tech and competition
articles.summary: The White House ‍is withdrawing its nomination ​of Ryan Baasch for a Federal Trade Commission ⁠seat and instead naming him deputy director of the National Economic Council, elevating his role in shaping tech, telecom and competition policy.

articles.title: Tech firms must block unsolicited nude images under new UK rules
articles.summary: Technology companies in Britain will be required to block ‍unsolicited sexual images under ​online safety rules taking effect on Thursday, as governments ⁠worldwide step up efforts to curb abuse and risks linked to artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Chinese tech companies, led by Zhipu AI, to rise in Hong Kong debut
articles.summary: Three ‍Chinese technology firms ​are set to ⁠debut higher on Thursday after raising a combined HK$9.3 billion ($1.19 ‌billion), ‌setting the tone for what investors ‌hope will be a busier year for new listings in Hong Kong.

articles.title: Judge indicates Elon Musk's fraud lawsuit against OpenAI will head to trial
articles.summary: A US judge has signalled that a jury will hear Elon Musk’s lawsuit accusing OpenAI of misleading him over its shift from a non-profit to a profit-driven company. The case will go to trial, likely involving testimony from Musk and chief Sam Altman. A 2017 diary entry by OpenAI executive Greg Brockman was among the information that Gonzalez Rogers cited to support her rationale for allowing Musk's lawsuit to go to trial.

articles.title: OpenAI earmarks $50 billion for employee stock grant pool: The Information
articles.summary: OpenAI reportedly reserved a large share pool for staff in October, said to equal 10% of the firm valued at $500 billion, The Information reported. The company is also exploring new funding talks that might lift its valuation to about $750 billion soon, a 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October.

articles.title: Infosys' land sale among transactions Karnataka opens probe into for bypassing e-khata
articles.summary: The revenue authorities have made e-khata, or the digital version of a property’s official record, a compulsory document for the seller to produce for registering a property. The Kaveri 2.0 portal is designed to fetch the e-khata from the e-Swathu portal during registration.

articles.title: Grok’s harmful turn shows clear legal gaps in AI regulation
articles.summary: The majority of the regulatory discussion has focused on proposed changes to the IT Rules, which would require platforms to label synthetic content and follow disclosure and tracking measures. Legal experts argue that this approach mainly places the burden on platforms that distribute content, while leaving significant gaps concerning AI tool developers and app stores that enable misuse.

articles.title: Introducing guardrails, refining safeguards for Grok, X tells Centre
articles.summary: X has told India it is tightening safeguards on its Grok chatbot after government orders over obscene and unlawful content. Authorities are reviewing the response and warned X could lose legal immunity if it fails to comply. Despite assurances, Grok continued generating explicit material, fuelling global criticism.

articles.title: Why Grok, not ChatGPT or Gemini, became epicentre of obscenity backlash
articles.summary: Grok’s Spicy mode has come under fire for generating non-consensual, sexually explicit images. Its deep integration with microblogging platform X has worked to its disadvantage, as Grok can be invoked directly in X posts, replies, and chats, pushing lewd images into the public feed by default.

articles.title: China asks tech firms to halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips: Report
articles.summary: Beijing has asked ‍some Chinese tech companies to ​halt orders for Nvidia's H200 chips this week, and ⁠is expected to mandate domestic artificial intelligence chip purchases, the Information reported on Wednesday.

articles.title: ASML says social media hacking claims are untrue
articles.summary: Dutch computer ​chip equipment ⁠supplier ASML said on Wednesday that claims ‌posted ‌on social media that ‌the company had been hacked were untrue.

articles.title: HSG's continuation fund to value ByteDance at up to $370 billion: Report
articles.summary: HSG, formerly Sequoia Capital China, is reportedly launching a new fund. This fund is expected to buy some of its shares in TikTok's parent company, ByteDance. The deal values ByteDance between $350 billion and $370 billion. This move comes as ByteDance's valuation continues to soar.

articles.title: Spotify makes it easier for creators to earn, reveals $10 billion podcast spend
articles.summary: Spotify is boosting its creator earnings program and introducing new tools for video podcasters. This move aims to enhance competition with platforms like YouTube and Netflix. The company has invested heavily in podcasts and is now lowering entry thresholds for its monetisation program. Video podcast consumption on Spotify has seen significant growth since the program's launch.

articles.title: Wix calls employees back to office; president says need to be fast due to AI
articles.summary: Zohar said that at a time when AI is having serious implications for business, the decision is driven by the belief that in-person collaboration boosts speed, creativity, problem-solving, and team connection.

articles.title: Meesho senior executive Megha Agarwal resigns
articles.summary: Megha Agarwal, general manager-business, Meesho has quit the ecommerce marketplace, according to a stock exchange filing. Agarwal, who reported directly to founder and CEO Vidit Aatrey, had joined Meesho in 2019 and was elevated to lead the company's growth function in 2022. She took over the role of general manager-business in 2023 when Utkrishta Kumar quit from the position.

articles.title: Chat platform Discord files confidentially for US IPO: Report
articles.summary: Chat platform Discord filed confidentially for an ‌initial ‌public offering in the United States. The US IPO market regained momentum in 2025 after nearly three years of sluggish activity, ​but hopes for a ​stronger rebound were tempered by tariff-driven volatility, ‌a ‍prolonged government shutdown and a late-year ‍selloff in artificial intelligence stocks.

articles.title: Grok obscene AI content: X submits response, IT Ministry deems it 'inadequate'
articles.summary: The government has sought more details from X, including specific action taken on obscene content linked to its Grok AI and steps to prevent a repeat in future, sources said on Wednesday, adding that the response submitted by the firm, while detailed, was not adequate.

articles.title: GameStop announces stock option award for CEO tied to $100 billion market-cap target
articles.summary: The company said Cohen will receive no ​guaranteed pay in the form ​of salary, cash bonuses or ‌stock ‍options under the package, making ‍his compensation entirely "at-risk" of achieving the ambitious ‌targets.

articles.title: Nvidia CEO says purchase orders, not formal declaration, will signal Chinese approval of H200
articles.summary: Earlier on Tuesday in an interview with a JPMorgan analyst, Nvidia CFO Colette Kress said that the U.S. government is "working feverishly" on license applications for Nvidia to ​ship its H200 chips to China, but that the company still does not know when ​they will be approved.

articles.title: Samsung Electronics to buy $1.73 billion of its shares for employee compensation
articles.summary: The ​shares will be ‌acquired ‍through ‍purchases on the stock market between ‌January 8 and April 7, Samsung said in a regulatory ‍filing.

articles.title: Qualcomm in talks with Samsung Electronics for contract manufacturing: Report
articles.summary: The ‌South Korean paper cited Amon as saying that Qualcomm was holding talks first with Samsung Electronics, among ​several semiconductor foundry firms, ​about contract manufacturing using the ‌latest ‍two-nanometre process, with design ‍work already completed for commercialisation in ‌the near future.

articles.title: KLA expands India presence with Rs 300 crore R&D and innovation hub
articles.summary: ET was the first to report on November 3 that the American wafer fab equipment maker was in talks with the Tamil Nadu government to set up an R D centre in the city.

articles.title: Info Edge’s standalone revenues rise 12%  to Rs 747 crore in Q3FY26
articles.summary: During the nine months of FY26, the company’s standalone revenues stood at Rs 2,120 crore, compared to Rs 1,898 crore in the year prior, it said in a filing ahead of the financial results for the third quarter.

articles.title: Job cuts 2026: Reports suggest Microsoft may announce job cuts in January
articles.summary: Microsoft could be planning a round of job cuts this month, affecting teams in Gaming, Azure, and Sales, reports HR Digest. Between 5% and 10% of staff may be impacted, as the company aims to reduce middle management and increase individual contributor ratios. Microsoft, however, has not officially confirmed or denied the potential layoffs.

articles.title: Meta names Microsoft's Mahoney as chief legal officer
articles.summary: Meta Platforms has appointed C.J. Mahoney as its new chief legal officer, with the former Microsoft executive set to report directly to CEO Mark Zuckerberg. He replaces Jennifer Newstead, who is leaving to join Apple. The move comes as Meta faces lawsuits and regulatory scrutiny over user safety, particularly around minors.

articles.title: ETtech Explainer: Inside the 10-minute delivery model of quick commerce
articles.summary: The recent all-India gig worker strike highlighted whether the 10-minute quick commerce model is necessary, at the cost of riders risking their lives to deliver orders quickly. So, how is this 10-minute delivery system, which did not exist a few years ago, actually executed?

articles.title: Meta is delaying global rollout of Ray-Ban Display glasses, here's why
articles.summary: Meta is halting the global rollout of its Ray-Ban smart glasses. Strong demand in the United States has led to supply shortages. The company will focus on fulfilling American orders. International expansion is on hold as Meta reassesses its strategy. Waitlists for the popular glasses now extend into 2026. New features are also being introduced.

articles.title: CPSE Capex reached 74.5% of target by December, set to exceed annual target by fair margin
articles.summary: The Capex for the month of December alone increased by 9.28% to Rs 70,000 crore, with many enterprises exceeding their annual budget target. The growth was led by the Railway board and National Highway Authority of India(NHAI) as they remained the highest spenders.

articles.title: 61,000 crorepati taxpayers added in last one year
articles.summary: India saw a significant rise in wealthy taxpayers. Over 61,000 new individuals joined the crorepati club, bringing the total to 351,000. The number of super-rich individuals, earning over ₹10 crore, also grew substantially. Improved tax compliance and advanced data analytics are credited for this expansion. This trend reflects a growing economy and better adherence to tax regulations across the nation.

articles.title: UN raises India's 2026 GDP forecast to 6.6%, pegs next yr's growth at 6.7%
articles.summary: India's economic horizon shines bright with projections of 6.6% growth by 2026 and 6.7% by 2027, as forecasted by the UN. This surge is fueled by vigorous consumer activity and substantial public investments. With supportive policy initiatives in place, India's position as one of the world's fastest-evolving economies is firmly established.

articles.title: Go Swadeshi: CEA V Anantha Nageswaran calls for urgent indigenisation amid global trade headwinds
articles.summary: The Chief Economic Adviser has spotlighted key industries such as semiconductors, defence production, and critical industrial chemicals for self-sufficiency. Targeting a decrease in import reliance, this plan aspires to elevate India's economic influence internationally.

articles.title: India to grow 6.6% in 2026 on strong consumption, public investment: UN
articles.summary: The UN has upgraded India's economic growth projection to 6.6% for 2026, citing resilient private consumption and strong public investment. Policy measures and lower interest rates are expected to boost near-term growth, with India projected to remain one of the fastest-growing economies globally.

articles.title: UN predicts world economic growth to slip to 2.7% in 2026
articles.summary: Global economic growth is set to slow in 2026 before picking up in 2027. The United States economy is expected to see modest growth. China's economy will continue its expansion. India's growth is projected to remain strong, supported by consumption and public investment. These forecasts come from a United Nations report.

articles.title: Over Rs 1.52 lakh cr locked in Customs disputes; govt may look at amnesty scheme in FY27 Budget
articles.summary: Price Waterhouse Co suggests the government consider an amnesty scheme in the 2026-27 Budget to resolve over Rs 1.52 lakh crore in customs duty litigations. The firm also advocates for rationalizing customs duty slabs to 5-6 and reducing duties on raw materials to address inverted duty structures arising from Free Trade Agreements.

articles.title: RBI considering fresh exporter relief steps after low take‑up of loan moratorium, sources say
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is exploring new measures to aid Indian exporters facing U.S. tariffs. A previous loan repayment moratorium saw limited participation. The central bank is now considering easing eligibility for the moratorium or offering fresh subsidized loans. Discussions are ongoing with export agencies to assess future order flows before finalizing new support.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Why do India’s farms suddenly matter?
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: India's agriculture, despite its challenges, holds immense potential as a global growth engine amidst shifting trade dynamics. Lessons from the shrimp export crisis highlight the power of market diversification and value addition. Budget 2026-27 can unlock this 'power-lifter' role by investing in agri-logistics and predictable trade policies, transforming a managed sector into a strategic asset.

articles.title: 'Goldilocks moment': BJP on India's GDP seen growing 7.4% in FY26
articles.summary: As India gears up for a dynamic economic phase, experts anticipate a substantial 7.4 percent growth in the forthcoming fiscal year, with a continuation of this positive trend through 2027. The encouraging trajectory can be largely attributed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's initiatives aimed at enhancing transparency and driving essential reforms.

articles.title: Finance Ministry plans to scrap curbs on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts, sources say
articles.summary: India's finance ministry is set to remove restrictions on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts. These curbs were imposed in 2020 following border tensions. The move aims to boost commercial ties and address project delays. Several ministries have requested exemptions to overcome constraints. A high-level committee also recommended easing these measures.

articles.title: Auri Grow India launches AI-powered carbon credit agritech platform
articles.summary: Auri Grow India has launched CarbonKrishi, an AI-enabled platform designed to onboard one lakh farmers and generate an estimated Rs 16-50 crore in annual carbon credits. The platform utilizes AI, satellite imagery, and crop data to assess farm-level carbon impact.

articles.title: NITI Aayog invites EoI for preparation of India Innovation Index 2025
articles.summary: India Innovation Index is prepared by the NITI Aayog in collaboration with a suitable knowledge partner. The first edition of the Index, called India Innovation Index 2019 (III 2019), was launched in October, 2019 followed by India Innovation Index 2020 launched in January, 2021, and India Innovation Index 2021 launched in July, 2022.

articles.title: India projected to grow at 6.6%, resilient consumption, public investment to offset US tariffs impact: UN
articles.summary: India's economy is set for robust growth at 6.6 percent in 2026. This strong performance is expected despite a challenging global environment. Resilient consumer spending and significant public investment will largely counter the impact of higher US tariffs. India will continue to be the world's fastest-growing major economy.

articles.title: India's FY26 GDP growth may exceed NSO estimate after base year revision: SBI report
articles.summary: According to the report, the first advance estimate (AE) released by the National Statistical Office pegs GDP growth at 7.4 per cent in FY26, compared to 6.5 per cent in FY25. Gross Value Added (GVA) growth is estimated at 7.3 per cent, while nominal GDP growth is projected at 8 per cent.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Fewer customs duty slabs, simplified tariff structure soon
articles.summary: Union Budget: India plans to simplify its customs duty structure. The government is considering reducing the number of duty slabs to five or six. This move aims to cut down on disputes and make import duties align better with national priorities. The upcoming budget is expected to announce these changes.

articles.title: India’s GDP growth estimated at 7.4% in FY26: Government data
articles.summary: India's economy is projected to grow by 7.4% in FY26, surpassing earlier expectations and driven by increased investment and a manufacturing surge. This expansion is expected to push the nation's GDP beyond the $4 trillion mark, supported by accommodative policies and favorable domestic conditions despite global uncertainties.

articles.title: Synthetic mint dents India's grip on global mentha market
articles.summary: India's natural mentha oil industry faces a crisis. Exports and production have fallen significantly. Synthetic mint, a cheaper lab-grown alternative, is flooding markets. Farmers are shifting to other crops as demand for natural mentha wanes. Bulk buyers now prefer the synthetic version for its consistent quality and lower cost. This trend threatens the future of India's natural mint farming.

articles.title: Cotton imports zoom as traders reap zero duty window benefit
articles.summary: In an unprecedented move, India has brought in three million cotton bales during the December quarter, spurred by a newly established duty-free window. This influx can be attributed to declining domestic yields and crop damage affecting quality. With projections indicating sustained high imports through FY26, mills have fortified their inventories of cotton, securing supplies until May or June.

articles.title: India must rein in imports, push exports: Nitin Gadkari
articles.summary: India aims to be the world's third-largest economy. Minister Nitin Gadkari stated this requires reducing imports and boosting exports. He highlighted converting agricultural waste into a national resource. This process can cut pollution from crop burning. It also strengthens the circular economy. Blending 15% with agro-waste can save foreign exchange. This will significantly reduce dependence on imported crude oil.

articles.title: India’s economy to outperform in FY26 with 7.4% growth: HDFC
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth in FY26. Gross Domestic Product is projected to expand by 7.4 percent. This expansion is driven by private consumption and government investment. Services and manufacturing sectors are expected to perform well. Growth is anticipated to moderate in the second half of the fiscal year.

articles.title: Centre sets guidelines for AI-driven cancer diagnosis
articles.summary: India now regulates AI software for cancer detection. These tools analyze medical images like X-rays and CT scans. They are now classified as Class C medical devices. This means they need official approval and safety checks. Developers must follow quality standards. This move ensures patient safety as AI use grows in healthcare.

articles.title: India's GDP pegged to grow at 7.4% for FY26 despite tariff heat
articles.summary: India anticipates robust economic growth of 7.4% in fiscal 2025-26. This projection highlights the nation's economic strength despite global challenges. The government's initiatives, including tax relief and GST adjustments, are expected to boost consumer demand. Manufacturing and services sectors are poised for significant expansion, positioning India as a leading economy in Asia.

articles.title: Gadkari calls for import cuts, export push to make India 3rd-largest economy
articles.summary: India aims to be the world's third-largest economy. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari stated that reducing imports and boosting exports are crucial. He highlighted converting agricultural waste into bio-bitumen for road construction. This initiative will save foreign exchange and reduce crude oil dependence. The move supports sustainable development and rural livelihoods. India is also exploring green hydrogen-powered trucks to cut pollution.

articles.title: NITI Aayog calls for fiscal incentives to push development of affordable houses in India
articles.summary: In its report on ‘A Comprehensive Framework to Promote Affordable Housing’, developed jointly with the ministry of housing and urban affairs, the Aayog has proposed a slew of incentives for developers and buyers of affordable houses, including reintroduction of the provision of 100% tax exemption to developers involved in approved affordable housing projects and doubling of loan limit to Rs 40 lakh under the Credit Risk Guarantee Fund Scheme for Low Income Housing.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India's time for power move to cut reliance on China and others
articles.summary: Union Budget of India: India is strengthening domestic manufacturing and securing supply chains. The upcoming union budget will fund local production and build strategic buffers. This shift prioritizes economic resilience over cost efficiency. The nation aims to reduce reliance on imported energy, electronics, and defence equipment. Diversifying oil supplies and boosting local defence production are key strategies.

articles.title: Easing inflation, strong macros to drive FMCG consumption this year
articles.summary: Fast-moving consumer goods consumption is set for a 5% growth in early 2026. Strong economic indicators and rising demand are driving this positive outlook. Consumers are expected to shop more and opt for premium products as prices stabilize. Leading companies like Marico and Dabur are already seeing early signs of recovery.

articles.title: Services activity hits 11-month low on slower output, new biz gains
articles.summary: India's services sector saw a slowdown in December 2025, reaching an 11-month low. New business and output growth moderated. Companies also held back on hiring additional staff. Manufacturing activity also slackened. The overall composite index fell. Firms remain optimistic for 2026, but sentiment dipped due to market uncertainty and exchange rate concerns. Export orders strengthened.

articles.title: IBBI revamps liquidation forms to cut compliance burden on IPs
articles.summary: The Insolvency Bankruptcy Board of India has introduced new electronic forms for liquidation processes. These revised forms aim to simplify compliance for insolvency professionals and enhance the accuracy of regulatory submissions. The changes will streamline data requirements and utilize technology for auto-population. Four forms, LIQ-1 to LIQ-4, will cover the entire liquidation journey.

articles.title: Parliamentary panel examines impact of higher US tariffs, meets affected sectors' stakeholders
articles.summary: A Parliamentary committee is studying the effects of increased US tariffs on Indian goods. The panel is visiting Visakhapatnam, Chennai, and Coimbatore to meet with industry leaders and government officials. They are examining challenges in the marine, automotive, leather, and textile sectors.

articles.title: India imported €144 billion worth of Russian oil since Ukraine war
articles.summary: India has become a major buyer of Russian crude oil since the Ukraine war. The country imported billions of euros worth of oil. This trade continues despite international sanctions. Some Indian companies have stopped purchases due to new US sanctions. Other refiners still buy from Russia. Russia's earnings from global fossil fuel sales are substantial.

articles.title: Tariff cut, reorientation of production to enhance global competitiveness: Niti Aayog
articles.summary: Niti Aayog recommends strategic steps for India to boost its global standing. Key measures include lowering tariffs and shifting production to popular segments like passenger vehicles. Strengthening quality standards and technology adoption are also vital. India's automotive exports have opportunities to grow in the global market.

articles.title: Sitharaman & Co line up ₹17 lakh crore PPP pipeline across 852 projects over three years
articles.summary: The Centre has unveiled a significant three-year Public Private Partnership project pipeline. This initiative encompasses 852 projects with an estimated cost exceeding ₹17 lakh crore. The pipeline aims to boost infrastructure development by providing early visibility to upcoming projects. Investors and developers can now plan their capital allocation and execution timelines effectively.

articles.title: RBI set for further easing — 50 bps cut possible in 2026: Report
articles.summary: India's central bank may cut policy rates by another 50 basis points in 2026. This follows significant reductions in 2025. The gap between the repo rate and core inflation provides room for more easing. Economic reforms and rate cuts are expected to boost GDP growth. Banks are poised for better performance as credit conditions improve.

articles.title: Ind-Ra projects India's GDP growth at 6.9 pc in FY27, goldilocks situation to persist
articles.summary: India Ratings Research forecasts India's economy to expand by 6.9 percent in the fiscal year 2026-27. Key reforms and trade agreements are expected to boost growth and protect the economy from global challenges. The nation anticipates a sustained period of high growth and moderate inflation.

articles.title: Tariff uncertainty clouds India’s spring-summer export season as US orders hang in balance
articles.summary: Tariff: For now, Indian exporters are holding the line, sharing costs with buyers and hoping that policy will catch up with commercial reality. The urgency, however, is deepening, and if clarity does not emerge soon, the impact may be felt not just in balance sheets, but in jobs and livelihoods.

articles.title: Rupee steady; bankers stay wary of central bank intervention
articles.summary: The Indian rupee remained steady on Friday. Strong demand for US dollars at the daily reference rate is impacting the local currency. The Reserve Bank of India's recent interventions are preventing significant one-way movements. Traders are cautious due to unexpected intervention levels. Global markets await key US economic data and a tariff ruling.

articles.title: India bond market on guard ahead of another large debt auction
articles.summary: Indian government bonds experienced a decline as traders anticipated substantial debt supply, fueling concerns about demand for the quarter's record sales. Yields rose as investors sold debt, anticipating further issuance. New Delhi is set to sell bonds worth approximately 290 billion rupees later today, adding to existing investor worries.

articles.title: China factor explained: Jefferies and JM Financial analysts decode the upside and risks for BHEL shares after 10% crash
articles.summary: Brokerages are divided on how a potential easing of India’s restrictions on Chinese firms bidding for government contracts could affect Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd. While Jefferies flags competitive risks if curbs are lifted, JM Financial argues that any relaxation, especially at the component level, would lower costs, improve execution and leave BHEL’s market position largely intact, underpinning its positive long-term outlook on the stock.

articles.title: Power EPCs, financiers top bets; pharma a four-part opportunity: Sunil Subramaniam
articles.summary: Sunil Subramaniam of Sense and Simplicity outlines how to play India’s power, pharma, auto and banking themes amid market volatility. He highlights EPCs and financiers as key power bets, explains a four-part pharma strategy, and shares why markets may stay cautious in the first half before improving later in the year.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO: How investors can improve chances of allotment via Coal India shareholders quota
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal IPO is creating buzz. Coal India shareholders have a special quota. Applying in this reserved portion can increase allotment chances. Investors can also apply in retail or employee categories simultaneously. Careful application and avoiding errors are key. BCCL is India's largest coking coal producer. The IPO is an offer for sale. The issue closes soon.

articles.title: Eternal shares jump 3% after Goldman dismisses bear theories
articles.summary: After a 17% correction in Eternal shares, Goldman Sachs said it disagrees with the level of bearishness priced into the stock and sees potential upside of 33% to Rs 390. The recent decline has been driven by concerns over a near-term slowdown in quick-commerce growth, rising competition, and the possible impact on Blinkit’s margins.

articles.title: Wealth tripled in 5 years, will Bharat Coking Coal IPO unlock more value for Coal India shareholders?
articles.summary: Coal India's value has tripled in five years. Now, its subsidiary Bharat Coking Coal's IPO is set to unlock more value. BCCL holds significant coking coal reserves, crucial for India's steel production. The listing offers clearer price discovery and better transparency. Investors can expect incremental gains as Coal India explores further subsidiary listings.

articles.title: Midcap multibagger stock tumbles 13% as Q3 net profit drops 33% to Rs 72 crore
articles.summary: Elecon Engineering Company's shares plunged 13.2% after reporting a 33% drop in Q3 FY26 net profit to Rs 72 crore, despite a marginal 4.3% revenue increase. The company cited order inflow delays and increased employee costs impacting EBITDA margins. However, management expressed confidence in future recovery due to healthy open orders and steady demand from key domestic and overseas industries.

articles.title: ITC, Eternal among 15 stocks in CLSA’s 2026 focus portfolio. Check full list & targets here
articles.summary: CLSA has unveiled its 2026 focus portfolio, featuring 15 stocks including ITC and Eternal, with a strategic tilt towards consumption, rate-sensitives, IT, and value plays. The brokerage anticipates bottom-up opportunities driven by improving earnings visibility and compressed stock valuations, despite potential index upside limitations.

articles.title: India Inc eyes best earnings growth in 2 years, but 9 companies may see over 50% profit fall in Q3
articles.summary: India Inc anticipates its strongest earnings growth in two years. However, several companies are expected to face significant profit declines. IndusInd Bank, PI Industries, Welspun Living, GAIL India, NATCO Pharma, Orchid Pharma, Bajaj Electricals, Sapphire Foods India, and KNR Construction are projected to see profits drop by 50% or more.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices open flat ahead of crucial US data. Should you buy now or wait?
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices traded flat to mildly higher on MCX amid global volatility and cautious sentiment ahead of key US jobs data. Analysts advise waiting for stability, even as long-term fundamentals and central bank buying continue to support bullion prices.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shares zoom 8% after telco confirms AGR relief, unveils repayment plan
articles.summary: Vodafone Idea share price: Vodafone Idea shares saw a significant jump on Friday. The company announced a repayment plan for its telecom dues to the Department of Telecommunications. This includes adjusted gross revenue liabilities. The dues will be frozen as of December 2025 and repaid over 15 years. This offers crucial cash flow relief to the company.

articles.title: RIL shares in spotlight as firm evaluates Venezuelan crude purchases
articles.summary: Reliance Industries shares are expected to gain attention. The company may buy Venezuelan crude oil. This depends on US regulations. India's refiners could import Venezuelan oil again. This oil might be cheaper. It could also be a safer alternative to Russian oil. Reliance has paused Russian oil deliveries.

articles.title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares rise 3% as talks advance on $8 billion Indo-German submarine deal
articles.summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares surged as India and Germany near an $8 billion submarine manufacturing deal, featuring technology transfer for indigenous production. This landmark agreement, involving Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems and MDL, signifies a major step in India's defense procurement strategy and its push for self-reliance in warship building.

articles.title: Bajaj Holdings, Swiggy among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: As of January 8, five stocks in the NSE F O segment saw a sharp increase in futures open interest, signalling rising derivatives activity. Higher open interest suggests fresh positions or expansion of existing bets, indicating growing trader participation and strengthening conviction around near-term price expectations.

articles.title: Thangamayil Jewellery among 5 stocks witnessing 5-year swing high breakouts
articles.summary: A 5-year swing high refers to the highest price a stock has achieved over the past five years.

articles.title: RVNL shares in focus after Rs 201 crore East Coast Railway order
articles.summary: Rail Vikas Nigam shares are in focus after the company secured a Rs 201.23 crore order from East Coast Railway to set up a wagon Periodical Overhauling workshop in Odisha. The 18-month domestic project is expected to bolster RVNL’s order book even as the stock ended lower in the previous session.

articles.title: US ETFs still matter—but stock selection will drive returns in 2026, says Amit Jain
articles.summary: Global markets face 2026 with high valuations and geopolitical risks. Investors are advised to shift focus from broad US ETFs to selective stock and sector investments. Geopolitical events may cause short-term volatility, impacting energy and defense stocks. Disciplined stock selection and valuation sensitivity will be key to navigating the US market cycle.

articles.title: BEL shares jump 2% after securing Rs 569 crore worth of defence orders since last disclosure
articles.summary: Following the exciting revelation of new orders valued at Rs 569 crore, shares of Bharat Electronics have seen a notable upturn. The contracts, which involve state-of-the-art drone detection and jamming equipment as well as mobile communication terminals, signify a positive boost to BEL's already substantial order book.

articles.title: Bansal Wire shares decline 5% as 20% equity becomes eligible for trading after lock-in expiry
articles.summary: Bansal Wire Industries shares fell to a new 52-week low. This happened as a six-month lock-in period for a significant portion of its shares ended. Over 31 million shares, nearly 20% of the company, are now eligible for trading. The company recently reported record sales volumes for the December quarter.

articles.title: BHEL shares rise 3% after Rs 5,400 crore order win from JV firm with CIL
articles.summary: BHEL share price: Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited shares rose significantly after securing a major Rs 5,400 crore order for a coal gasification project in Odisha. The company will design, engineer, and supply equipment for the project. Additionally, BHEL has begun supplying traction converters for the Vande Bharat Sleeper Train.

articles.title: IEX shares jump 7% ahead of APTEL hearing on market coupling case
articles.summary: Indian Energy Exchange shares saw a surge as the Electricity Appellate Tribunal prepares to hear arguments on market coupling. This crucial case could reshape electricity price discovery, impacting IEX's dominant market share. Investor optimism grew following the regulator's willingness to reconsider its earlier order, with today's hearing expected to provide further clarity.

articles.title: BCCL IPO GMP Live Updates: Bharat Coking Coal GMP hints at 43.5% returns on listing; issue gets fully subscribed on strong NII demand

Snowflake CEO on AI, search & more; Razorpay joins IPO queue
articles.summary: Happy Friday! Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy spoke with ET about the impending overhaul of online search due to AI. This and more in today's ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Generative & agentic AI to level barriers and unlock market for Indian cos: AWS executive
articles.summary: Generative and agentic AI could help Indian firms compete globally by easing language, regulatory and operational hurdles, according to AWS. Executives said the technology allows companies to scale products across markets more easily. AWS is investing heavily in autonomous AI agents to drive wider adoption and new business models.

articles.title: ETtech Interview: From online search to data stacks, AI is forcing a reset: Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy
articles.summary: Sridhar Ramaswamy, who spent 15 years at Google and helmed the tech major’s massive advertising business, said legacy players will find it hard to match the pace of startups such as OpenAI in web searches. IIT Madras alumnus Ramaswamy underscored India’s importance as a key growth and talent hub for Snowflake that is investing in AI upskilling for its 500-plus local workforce. Edited excerpts:

articles.title: ET Graphics: AI Summit lays out red carpet for India’s sovereign AI dreams
articles.summary: As India accelerates efforts to build a sovereign AI stack, a dozen startups and institutions backed by the government’s IndiaAI Mission are preparing to launch indigenous foundation models. Many of these launches are timed around the India AI Impact Summit next month.

articles.title: EU orders X to keep Grok documents for longer amid sexualised AI photos furore
articles.summary: The EU executive on Thursday said it ordered Elon Musk's Grok to keep data related to the AI chatbot after the tool sparked a backlash for generating sexualised deepfakes of minors. The order means the EU executive can ask X for access to the documents as it looks into the platform and Grok.

articles.title: State govt aims to make Delhi India's startup hub: Education minister
articles.summary: Education Minister Ashish Sood said the government, through the Directorate of Training and Technical Education (DTTE), is strengthening the campus-to-market ecosystem by encouraging students and young innovators to take up entrepreneurship as a mainstream career option.

articles.title: China's AI startup MiniMax Group raises $619 million in Hong Kong IPO
articles.summary: Chinese ‍artificial intelligence startup MiniMax Group ​said on Thursday it raised HK$4.82 billion ($618.60 million) ⁠in its Hong Kong initial public offering after pricing shares at HK$165 each.

articles.title: Cyera valued at $9 billion as data security firm raises $400 million
articles.summary: Data security firm Cyera said on ‍Thursday it raised $400 ​million in a late-stage funding round, with ⁠its valuation tripling in little over a year to $9 billion, highlighting the surge in demand for AI-driven data ‌protection tools.

articles.title: DeepSeek's AI gains traction in developing nations, Microsoft report says
articles.summary: In the Thursday report, researchers from Microsoft said global adoption of generative AI tools reached 16.3% of the world's population in the three months to December, up from 15.1% in the previous three months.

articles.title: The Sleep Company appoints former Eternal exec Hemal Jain as CFO
articles.summary: Jain brings over two decades of experience spanning FMCG, food tech, quick commerce, B2B, and startup consulting. He previously served as global head of finance and CFO of Eternal’s B2B grocery supply arm, Hyperpure, and was part of the senior management team that took the company public in July 2021.

articles.title: PM Modi chairs roundtable with select startups ahead of India AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a roundtable discussion with 12 shortlisted startups under the foundational model pillar of the India AI Impact Summit 2026.

articles.title: AI marketing platform Nitro Commerce secures $5 million from Cornerstone Ventures, others
articles.summary: The startup uses artificial intelligence (AI) solutions to help consumer brands address challenges around customer acquisition, attribution, and engagement across online and offline channels. Nitro said it is targeting $10 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR) over the next six months.

articles.title: Snowflake to acquire Observe, offer its AI observability tools to enterprises
articles.summary: In a statement, Snowflake said the Observe platform will be integrated directly into its AI data cloud so that enterprises can easily ingest and retain all of their telemetry data, including logs, metrics, and traces, while lowering observability costs by up to 60%.

articles.title: UpGrad-Unacademy deal talks fail; Amagi downsizes IPO
articles.summary: Talks between edtech companies Unacademy and UpGrad for a potential acquisition have fallen through. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: TakeMe2Space raises $5 million, led by Chiratae Ventures
articles.summary: The startup said it will use the capital to expand its satellite constellation to six spacecraft, scale real-time in-orbit AI inferencing, and accelerate R D for megawatt-scale compute satellites. The company said it will also expand its presence across India, the US, and Australia.

articles.title: UpGrad pulls out of talks to acquire Unacademy over valuation differences
articles.summary: The discussions stalled due to differing valuation expectations between the two sides. “The deal talks were officially called off today. The two sides couldn’t align on the final number for the valuation,” one of the persons said.

articles.title: Practo expands to US after UAE debut last year
articles.summary: Health-tech platform Practo has launched its care navigation service in the United States. The company has already seen significant adoption, listing over two lakh doctors. Practo aims to strengthen its US team and explore acquisitions.

articles.title: Textbooks to podcasts: Google turns lessons into podcasts with new Gemini classroom tool
articles.summary: Google has launched a Gemini-powered tool that lets teachers create podcast-style audio lessons in Google Classroom. The feature targets students’ growing preference for audio learning and is now rolling out to education subscribers. While interest is strong, some teachers remain wary of over-reliance on AI in classrooms.

articles.title: Germany's SME firms 'Mittelstand' cuts AI investments in 2025, study shows
articles.summary: German SMEs are pulling back on their investments in artificial intelligence, a sharp contrast to their counterparts in other sectors who are ramping up spending. Analysts caution that this divergence could lead to a notable technology disparity.

articles.title: Nvidia requires full upfront payment for H200 chips in China: Report
articles.summary: Nvidia reportedly is demanding a full upfront payment for its H200 AI chips from Chinese buyers. This strict policy aims to mitigate risks amid uncertainty over Beijing's approval for shipments. Chinese tech firms have placed significant orders for these advanced chips.

articles.title: Arm launches 'Physical AI' unit, joining rush to robotics by tech and automakers
articles.summary: Robots and autos are the core of Physical AI and share a wide range of existing sensor tech and other hardware. Automakers including Tesla are creating robots to automate warehouse and factory tasks. The head of the newly formed unit, Drew Henry, said that physical AI solutions could "fundamentally ‍enhance labour, free up extra time" and may have a considerable impact on gross domestic product as ‌a result.

articles.title: Google, Character.AI agree to settle suits involving teen suicide
articles.summary: Google and Character.AI have agreed in principle to settle several lawsuits by families alleging AI chatbots harmed children, including a case linked to a teenager’s suicide. The terms remain private and need court approval. The cases intensified global concern over child safety and emotional dependence on AI tools.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi Metro phase 5A approved: 13 stations, 16 km corridor at ₹12,015 crore
Beyond 1 crore WhatsApp bans; Oyo's third attempt at IPO
articles.summary: The government wants to know more about accounts banned by WhatsApp in India. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation
School assembly news headlines for December 23: Top national, international business & sports updates
articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: India fast-tracks key reforms to shield itself from US tariffs
articles.summary: In its final parliament session of the year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government pushed through major economic reforms aimed at boosting growth amid trade challenges. Parliament approved bills allowing private investment in nuclear energy, full foreign ownership of insurance firms, and a unified securities market code.

articles.title: India valuations fair, earnings key to upside over next 12 months: Mark Matthews
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are poised for steady, healthy growth, driven by the gradual payoff of fiscal and monetary stimulus. While global markets face volatility, India's lack of an AI boom may position it as a favored diversification destination for cyclical exposure. Expect earnings-led returns rather than valuation rerating.

articles.title: Catching the Market’s Swing: How traders ride market moves across India, US and global bourses
articles.summary: Swing trading sits comfortably between long-term investing and high-frequency day trading, appealing to market participants who want to capture short- to medium-term price movements without being glued to screens all day.

articles.title: India’s growth story intact despite FII outflows, sentiment the key risk: Jim Walker
articles.summary: Market strategist Jim Walker expresses astonishment at foreign investors selling Indian equities, deeming it a "madness" given India's status as the world's fastest-growing major economy. He believes recent selling is profit-taking, with investors likely to regret overlooking India's long-term fundamentals and domestic growth drivers.

articles.title: Nasdaq is planning for near 24-hour trading. What does it mean for Indian stock markets?
articles.summary: Nasdaq’s plan for 24x7 trading could change how Indian markets absorb global cues, with price discovery becoming continuous rather than overnight. Experts say this may raise opening gaps and short-term volatility in globally sensitive sectors, even as India’s long-term market drivers remain largely domestic.

articles.title: School News Assembly Headlines for December 15, 2025: Top national, international, sports and business update
articles.summary: News headlines for December 15: Delhi schools are now operating in a hybrid mode due to pollution. Prime Minister Modi embarks on a visit to Jordan. New tourism facilities have opened in Kashmir. The BJP has a new national working president. A mass shooting occurred in Sydney. India leads South Africa in the T20 series. The Odisha Masters badminton tournament has concluded.

articles.title: Elon Musk's X faces possible UK ban over sexualised AI images
articles.summary: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer condemned the incident as “disgraceful and unacceptable,” saying such content would not be tolerated. He stressed that the platform must take responsibility and rein the situation in, adding that media regulator Ofcom has the government’s full backing to act.

articles.title: Vodafone's AGR relief, US Supreme Court on Trump tariffs, Trump on China and Taiwan, Q3 results and more
articles.summary: In today's newsletter, we take a look at Vodafone's timeline on AGR, the US Supreme Court's call on Trump's pivotal tariff regime, Q3 results today, IREDA results, Power Mech's major order win worth over ₹3,126 crore and more. Here is all you need to know with CNBC-TV18's Newsletter

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: IEX shares fall 10% from highs on CERC market coupling circular before APTEL hearing
articles.summary: APTEL is supposed to hear the market coupling case at 10:30 AM. The tribunal had said that if there are clear views expressed, the case will be heard and wrapped up on Friday itself.

articles.title: Denmark orders ‘shoot first’ in case of US invasion of Greenland
articles.summary: The renewed tension comes after US President Trump again underlined Greenland’s strategic importance to the US, shortly after authorising a military operation against Venezuela’s president.

articles.title: AI Overviews, suggested personalised replies and more: What Gmail in Gemini era means
articles.summary: The Gmail update, announced by Google CEO Sundar Pichai on X, includes AI Overviews, Suggested Replies, Proofread, and AI Inbox, among other features.

articles.title: SEBI updates SIF reporting rules: What investors should know
articles.summary: SEBI introduces new compliance rules for Specialised Investment Funds, mandating detailed reporting by AMCs and trustees to boost transparency and investor protection for retail investors.

articles.title: Apollo Hospitals, Max Health may see further earnings downgrades, bearish Macquarie warns
articles.summary: Shares of Apollo Hospitals and Max Healthcare have underperformed the Nifty 50 by 14% in 2025 so far. Macquarie expects further consensus earnings downgrades to continue weighing on the stocks in 2026.

articles.title: Rupee opens higher against dollar: What’s driving early gains
articles.summary: The Indian rupee opened at 89.87 against the U.S. dollar, buoyed by RBI intervention amid weak Asian cues, portfolio outflows, and U.S.-India trade tensions flagged by Donald Trump.

articles.title: ED raids I-PAC office: Mamata to lead protests as court battle set to begin
articles.summary: Addressing the controversy, Banerjee accused the ED of overreach, claiming sensitive party material had been seized during the operation.

articles.title: Stock recommendations: Experts suggest buy and sell calls across sectors
articles.summary: On Friday, market tech analysts Somil Mehta, Shrikant Chouhan and Mitessh Thakkar recommended these stocks for the short term.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices cool in India: Why experts see this as a pause, not a reversal
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices fell in India as US dollar strength and global cues weighed on sentiment. Silver outperformed gold, driven by supply deficits and industrial demand.

articles.title: West Bengal Guv CV Ananda Bose gets death threat, security tightened
articles.summary: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose receives death threat email; security tightened. CM Mamata Banerjee and Union Home Ministry informed.

articles.title: Reliance Industries' refining margin can improve further on Venezuela oil revival, Goldman says
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs expects moderation in RIL's retail earnings growth in Q3, citing weak discretionary spending, base effects and the timing of the festive season. However, this is likely to be partly offset by a strong, refining led performance in the energy business.

articles.title: Chinese buyers squeeze copper purchase as prices hit record high
articles.summary: The muted activity is not unusual. Operating rates for all fabricators were at multiyear lows for the season, even in the autumn, when demand usually peaks. In the end, the market is suffering as a result of the economy's poor pandemic recovery and structurally weaker growth.

articles.title: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura vie to control Venezuelan oil exports
articles.summary: Chevron, Vitol, Trafigura and others vie for U.S. deals to export Venezuelan crude as Washington seeks indefinite control after capturing President Nicolas Maduro, reshaping global oil dynamics.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea shares see sharp fall from highs; Here's the AGR dues repayment timeline
articles.summary: The government is the largest shareholder in Vodafone Idea and has made it clear on multiple instances that they do not want a duopoly in the Indian telecom market, although, they have no intentions to increase their stake further beyond the current 49%.

articles.title: Nepal's PM Karki holds one-on-one meeting with ousted premier Oli regarding Mar 5 election
articles.summary: Sushila Karki met KP Sharma Oli in Baluwatar to discuss the March 5 elections, security, and Nepal's political situation after travel restrictions on Oli were lifted post Gen Z protests.

articles.title: Credit card spending rises over 11% in November: CareEdge flags key drivers
articles.summary: India’s credit card spending rose 11.5% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in November 2025, driven by deeper card penetration and digital usage, as per CareEdge Ratings, despite post-festive moderation.

articles.title: Iran sees internet and phones blackout as protesters heed exiled prince's call for mass demonstration
articles.summary: Iran cut internet and phone lines as protests led by Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi erupted, with chants against Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. At least 42 killed, 2270 detained, and violence reported nationwide.

articles.title: China's Anta Sports offers to buy Pinault family's 29% Puma stake: report
articles.summary: Artemis had been expecting any offer for its Puma stake to exceed 40 euros a share, a fourth person with knowledge of the matter told Reuters. All four sources spoke on condition of anonymity because the matter is private.

articles.title: JioBlackRock MF launches low and short duration debt funds
articles.summary: JioBlackRock Mutual Fund launches Low Duration Fund and Short Duration Fund, open for subscription from January 8 to 13, targeting low and short-duration fixed income investors.

articles.title: BHEL shares gain after bagging ₹5,400 crore order from JV with Coal India in Odisha
articles.summary: Although this is a related party transaction, UBS believes that it will have a positive read-through for BHEL as it is the first commercial use of the company's proprietary technology, taking the company towards the execution stage from R D.

articles.title: Modi to launch cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims, says Nitin Gadkari
articles.summary: Nitin Gadkari announced Prime Minister Narendra Modi will soon launch a nationwide cashless treatment scheme for road accident victims, offering up to ₹1.5 lakh per victim for seven days.

articles.title: Russian strikes knock out power in southeastern Ukraine, says energy ministry
articles.summary: Russian strikes cut power in Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia, forcing hospitals and critical sites onto reserve power. Oleksiy Kuleba and Ivan Fedorov lead urgent repairs amid freezing weather.

articles.title: Why Indian markets should not be 'underweight': Bernstein's Rupal Agarwal explains
articles.summary: Thursday's sell-off on Dalal Street wiped out over ₹8 lakh crore in investor wealth, but despite the relentless FII selling, Rupal Agarwal of Bernstein believes that the Indian market does not warrant an "underweight" stance.

articles.title: Rio Tinto, Glencore in talks to form world’s biggest miner
articles.summary: A combination of the two companies would represent the largest-ever deal in an industry that has been gripped by takeover fever as the biggest producers seek to bulk up on copper — a crucial metal for the energy transition that is trading near record highs. Glencore and Rio both own large copper assets, and the potential deal would create a new mining behemoth to rival BHP Group, which has long held the title of the biggest miner.

articles.title: Bandhan AMC launches Arudha Hybrid Long-Short Fund under its maiden SIF strategy
articles.summary: Bandhan AMC launches Arudha Hybrid Long-Short Fund under SIF, blending debt and market-neutral equity for stability and arbitrage. Units to be listed on NSE and BSE for investor access.

articles.title: Trump administration mulls payments to sway Greenlanders to join US
articles.summary: US officials discussed paying Greenlanders up to 100000 each to encourage secession from Denmark and possible US association, despite strong opposition from Copenhagen and Nuuk.

articles.title: Bansal Wire Industries shares in focus as 20% outstanding equity frees up for trade today
articles.summary: Around 31.3 million shares, or nearly 20% of the company's total outstanding equity, will become eligible for trading, according to Nuvama Alternative and Quantitative Research.

articles.title: India Post Payments Bank to roll out investment platform in partnership with Choice Wealth
articles.summary: India Post Payments Bank partners with Choice Wealth to launch a digital investment platform, offering mutual funds and robo-advisory services to over 11 crore customers nationwide.

articles.title: IEX Market Coupling Case LIVE Updates: Stock volatile, APTEL hearing begins, seeks clarity from CERC
articles.summary: IEX Market Coupling Case LIVE Updates | APTEL will hear the IEX vs CERC market coupling case at 10.30 am on January 9. IEX is seeking withdrawal of the CERC's July 2025 order on day-ahead market coupling, which also triggered significant volatility in the IEX stock. Watch this space for all the Live updates.

articles.title: Donald Trump attacks Republican senators who backed measures to curb Venezuela military action
articles.summary: After Maduro's capture, some lawmakers accused the administration of misleading Congress, including Democrats publicly and some Republicans behind the scenes. Maduro's capture and Trump's rhetoric have also raised concerns of military action to capture Greenland, an Arctic island that is a territory of Denmark, or against Colombia, Cuba or Iran.

articles.title: UN says US has 'legal obligation' to fund agencies after Trump withdraws from several organisations
articles.summary: Antonio Guterres urges the United States to fulfill its UN funding obligations after President Donald Trump withdraws support from 31 UN agencies, including UNFCCC and UN Population Fund.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO: ₹1,071 crore issue opens with strong anchor demand, should you subscribe?
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal has raised ₹273.13 crore from anchor investors. Marquee institutions that participated in the anchor include LIC, Societe Generale, Copthall Mauritius Investment Ltd, Citrine Fund, M7 Global Fund PCC - ASAS Global Opportunities Fund, Maybank Securities and Rajasthan Global Securities.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Oil prices extend gains as trader gauge Iran risks and Venezuela
articles.summary: The West Texas Intermediate rose over $58 a barrel after increased 3.2% in the earlier session. Meanwhile, Brent settled near $62.

articles.title: Asian shares edge higher ahead of US jobs data, tariff ruling
articles.summary: Equities opened in the green in Japan and Australia, while South Korea lagged. S P 500 witnessed a flat day on Thursday masked selling in tech behemoths such as Nvidia Corp. Treasury futures inched up and mortgage backed securities rallied after Trump said he was directing the purchase of $200 billion of mortgage bonds.

articles.title: Did You Know | If Mountbatten had known Jinnah was dying, Partition may never have happened
articles.summary: Years after presiding over the hurried and bloody Partition of India in 1947, Mountbatten, the last Viceroy of British India, made a confession. In a conversation with Dominique Lapierre, co-author of 'Freedom at Midnight,' Mountbatten reflected on how differently he would have handled the transfer of power had he known what Jinnah was hiding.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Day 1: ₹1,071 crore issue fully subscribed within 20 minutes led by NIIs, retail
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal has become the first mainboard IPO of 2026 on Dalal Street after a record year in 2025 that saw over 100 issues mop up more than ₹1.7 lakh crore.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.
